alert.note: Alert for Athens; Meigs; Washington (Ohio) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued December 25 at 5:12PM EST by NWS Charleston
info.description: ...A line of strong gusty showers will impact portions of northeastern Meigs, southern Washington, southeastern Athens, northern Calhoun, Wirt, northwestern Roane, northeastern Jackson, Wood, northern Harrison, Pleasants, Ritchie, Doddridge, northwestern Gilmer, northwestern Lewis and Tyler Counties through 600 PM EST... At 511 PM EST, Doppler radar was tracking a line of strong gusty showers near Parkersburg, moving southeast at 35 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Parkersburg, Clarksburg, Belpre, Spencer, Harrisville, St. Marys, Elizabeth, Middlebourne, Grantsville, Coolville, Forked Run State Park, Vienna, Bridgeport, Shinnston, Salem, Pennsboro, Belmont, Lumberport, West Union and Mineralwells. This includes the following highways... Interstate 79 between mile markers 127 and 128. Interstate 77 in West Virginia between mile markers 149 and 184. Route 50 in West Virginia between mile markers 1 and 78. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
